channel.title: karnaugh map on Notes
channel.description: Recent content in karnaugh map on Notes

item.title: CS137-lecture-20210211
item.description: A Karnaugh map is a graphical representation of a logic function. The map for \(n\) -input logic function is an array with \(2^n\) cells, (one for each possible input combination). To represent a logic function in a k-map, we copy the 1s from the truth table to the corresponding cells. Implicants are squares or rectangles made up of minterms Pairs of adjacent 1 cells in the k-map have minterms that differ in ONLY 1 variable The minterm pairs can be combined into a single product term using the generalization of theorem T10: T10) = term Thus, we can use k-maps to simplify the sum of the function.
